Document Text: To restore the provision for detailed statements to members of Congress and publication of summary statistics in the Congressional Record concerning the use of the franking privilege by members of Congress and the provision requiring that mass mailings clearly state that they are mailed at taxpayer expense.

Question: On Passage of the Bill S. 1816
Document Text: A bill to protect the retired pay of certain members of the Armed Forces convicted of an offense under section 2071(b) of title 18, United States Code.

Question: On the Motion for Attendance (Motion To Instruct)
On the Motion (Judge Nixon Motion For Trial)
On the Motion (Motion To Dismiss Article III)
Guilty or Not Guilty (Article I)
Guilty or Not Guilty (Article II)
Guilty or Not Guilty (Article III)
On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1082 to S. 1324 (Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Years 1990 and 1991)
Vote Title: Motion To Table Hollings Amendment No. 1082
Document Text: To strike out provisions relating to Inspector General.

Question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1087 to H.R. 2710 (Fair Labor Standards Amendments of 1989)
Document Text: To provide that the Congress shall not increase the business costs for small businesses that engage in an industry affecting commerce by enacting legislation that requires additional paperwork, capital expenditures, compliance costs, or taxes.

Question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1089 to H.R. 2710 (Fair Labor Standards Amendments of 1989)
Document Text: To strike the exclusion from the training wage for employers of migrant and seasonal agricultural workers.

Question: On Passage of the Bill H.R. 2710
Document Text: A bill to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage, and for other purposes.

Question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1091 to H.R. 3014 (Legislative Branch Appropriations Act, 1990)
Document Text: To eliminate unsolicited mass mailings and transfer savings to treatment of drug-dependent pregnant and post-partum women and their children.

Question: On the Motion (Motion To Waive The Budget Act)
Vote Title: Motion To Waive The Budget Act
Document Text: To grant the power to the President to reduce budget authority.

Question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 1127 to H.R. 3628 (Temporary Capital Gains Tax Reduction Act of 1989)
Vote Title: Motion To Invoke Cloture On Amendment No. 1127
Document Text: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to promote savings and long-term investment through a reduced capital gains tax rate and individual retirement plus accounts, and for other purposes.

Question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1121 to S. 1582 (Investment in Freedom and Democracy in Poland Act of 1989)
Document Text: To express the sense of the Senate regarding increasing the quota of the IMF.

Question: On Passage of the Bill H.R. 3402
Document Text: An Act to promote political democracy and economic pluralism in Poland and Hungary by assisting those nations during a critical period of transition and abetting the development in those nations of private business sectors, labor market reforms, and democratic institutions; to establish, through these steps, the framework for a composite program of Support for East European Democracy (SEED).

Question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 1127 to H.R. 3628 (Temporary Capital Gains Tax Reduction Act of 1989)
Vote Title: Motion To Invoke Cloture On Amendment No. 1127
Document Text: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to promote savings and long-term investment through a reduced capital gains tax rate and individual retirement plus accounts, and for other purposes.

Question: On the Conference Report H.R. 2461
Document Text: A bill to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 1990 and 1991 for military functions of the Department of Defense and to prescribe military personnel levels for such Department for fiscal years 1990 and 1991, and for other purposes.

Question: On the Motion (Motion To Disagree)
Document Text: A bill making appropriations for Foreign Assistance and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1990, and for other purposes.

Question: On the Decision of the Chair S.Amdt. 1135 to H.R. 2939 (Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 1990)
Document Text: Providing that none of the funds appropriated to the Bureau of the Census shall be used to count aliens in the U.S. in violation of the immigration laws for purposes of subsection (b) of Section 141 of title 13, U.S. Code.

Question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1146 to H.R. 3566 (Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1990)
Document Text: Concerning the restoration and correction of dial-a-porn sanctions.

Question: On the Motion to Postpone H.R. 3660
Document Text: A bill to amend the Rules of the House of Representatives and the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 to provide for government-wide ethics reform, and for other purposes.

Question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 1158 to H.R. 3660 (Ethics Reform Act of 1989)
Document Text: In the nature of a substitute.
Result: Cloture Motion Agreed to (90-9, 3/5 majority required)

Question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1160 to S.Amdt. 1158 to H.R. 3660 (Ethics Reform Act of 1989)
Document Text: To repeal the grandfather clause.

Question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1162 to H.R. 3660 (Ethics Reform Act of 1989)
Vote Title: Motion To Table Helms Amendment No. 1162
Document Text: To repeal pay increase provisions.

Question: On the Motion (Motion To Waive Budget Act)
Document Text: A bill to amend the Rules of the House of Representatives and the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 to provide for government-wide ethics reform, and for other purposes.

Question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1163 to H.R. 3660 (Ethics Reform Act of 1989)
Document Text: In the nature of a substitute.

Question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1164 to H.R. 3072 (Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 1990)
Document Text: No Statement of Purpose on File.

Question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1165 to H.R. 3072 (Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 1990)
Document Text: To delete all production funding for the B2 aircraft.

Question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1188 to H.R. 3743 (Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 1990)
Document Text: To restrict the amount available for military assistance for El Salvador until Salvadoran authorities have concluded investigative actions and apprehended and brought to trial those responsible for ordering and carrying out the November 16, 1989, murders of certain individuals in that country.

Question: On the Resolution S.Res. 217
Document Text: A resolution deploring the escalating violence in El Salvador; condemning the killing of innocent civilians, including six Jesuit priests; and calling for an immediate cessation of hostilities.
